body.name: First Aid Only 90922 Blue Nitrile Finger Cots, Disposable Rubber Finger Protectors, 144 Pack

byLineInfo.name: Visit the First Aid Only Store

deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 15 hrs 22 mins
body.description: First Aid Only Finger Cots are designed to protect your fingers during medical emergencies and can be used when treating blisters, cuts, burns, and stitches. Our finger protectors feature a smooth surface that makes them ideal for all types of applications, including applying ointment to minor wounds. Our rubber finger tips also help reduce the risk of contamination and infection when treating injuries. Take care of those minor scrapes anywhere with these essential first aid supplies.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: First Aid Refills Keeping your first aid kit or cabinet fully stocked is very important. First Aid Only offers a full selection of refill items to meet all your first aid needs. The individual boxes are perfectly sized for any application and can be used in both a first aid kit or as a stand-alone refill.

About Unitized Refill Boxes Feature 1: ANSI Color Guide Packaging Consistent color-coded packaging matches ANSI recommendations for easy identification when the user needs to find a first aid supply to treat an injury or know what to reorder for their kit. Feature 2: Organization Each unitized box is shrink-wrapped to keep product contained during shipping. Feature 3: Simplification Unit boxes simplify finding what you need in an emergency, as well as when you need to restock. Feature 4: Flexibility Missing a refill box in your First Aid Kit or Cabinet? The First Aid Only unitized refill boxes come in a variety of sizes to help you select the refill you need when replenishing your cabinet. The interchangeable refill boxes allow you to customize your kit or cabinet to meet the needs for a wide range of industries.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly What I Needed
reviews.reviewText: These nitrile finger cots are awesome! Early in the Covid-19 pandemic (back in March/April), I was unusually more distracted and clumsy when leaving home to search (i.e., shop) for food and household products all while having to remember to wear a mask. Stress makes us clumsy; and I was for a moment. I accidently closed the car door on my thumb - ouch! Yes, it left an awful bruise, swelling and eventually the death of the thumb nail. During the next 6 months as the nail died and grew out, it was important that I keep the nail bed and cuticle clean and calm to usher in the new, healthy nail. Because I love to cook and my Sunday hobby is baking, protecting the thumb and keeping clean in the kitchen was very important to me. Again, these nitrile finger cots are awesome! Clean, water proof, covers the entire thumb/finger, comfortable (not tight or restrictive), and did not interfere with my ability to handle cooking tools and utensils. I wore one when washing my hair to keep from snagging my hair with the lose nail - terrific. The finger cots also protected the finger from cleaning and drying agents (bleach, soap, etc) and allowed my thumb to health as expected. There are plenty of finger cots in the box. Easy to roll onto the finger. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You’re looking at it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars These work well
reviews.reviewText: I really like these because I don’t waste an entire glove. Removal is a pain. They’re really hard to get off your finger. You will most certainly get whatever you’re trying to avoid during the process of taking them off so be cautious of that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as it should
reviews.reviewText: I have eczema on my hands, and because I frequently work with heavy chemicals, my fingers tend to bleed. I used up my workplace's whole supply of finger cots in like a month. I bought these to keep at work, and they've been awesome. I have been using them for preventative measures lately - ointment, a little bit of gauze, waterproof medical tape, and then one of these bad boys, and my fingers stay intact all day long. Much less suffering in my life, lol.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than wearing a whole glove
reviews.reviewText: I wear medium sized gloves and these fit my fingers well to protect individual fingers instead of wearing a whole glove. I am a massage therapist and to protect the skin on the tips of my fingers during the winter months works well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: How can these be used for medicine when they are shipped this way? Tried once and contents were damaged. The box was squashed and contents were all over the larger box. Returned and tried again.Second shipment arrived today and box was squashed and contents went all over the floor when I opened the plastic packaging. Have to go to the trouble of returning them again. Unhygienic!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Small and tight for finger
reviews.reviewText: This finger cot should be bigger. My fingers are not big and it is very tight. The nitrile seems sturdy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for those tiny cuts on fingers and toes👍👍
reviews.reviewText: Great product to use on your cuts that you have on your fingers and toes, but yes...ppl use bandaids 1st then you put over the bandaid lol🤦‍♀️😊 just for those who do not know🤷‍♀️🤦‍♀️😁👍 and I call them finger condoms, but others may call them something else, ok what ever....fyi... when you look up finger condoms just know they will show some invasive finger condoms made for what you may think they use them for 🤣 lmao... just fyi...ok blabber mouth signing off
They are good and I can even use my iPhone or other device while wearing them. My only problem is that I ordered Large and the are very tight. I did not find an Extra large Nitrile Cot on Amazon

I find these work really well for whatever you need them for (e.g., first aid), however, they can be a bit snug, especially if worn for an extended period of time, so if you have really large hands then they may be too small. I have small hands, and I haven't had any issues with them.
Fast shipping, great product for pastel art! AAAAA+

reviews.reviewTitle: Very constricting , losing circulation in my fingers
reviews.reviewText: Bought these for crafting, since all nitrile gloves are currently unavailable for purchasing due to the pandemic (which is understandable) I thought these would work fine, just because with constant use of the product I use I get an allergic reaction. I found these way too small and constricting on my fingers and have ripples along the cot which gets transferred to the projects that I work on.
